result.execSummary:
The defendant Sunny Marie Sparks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 3 days presentence credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (6/27/16) unless a payment plan has been established.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Follow any and all mental health treatment.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 5/26/16. Defendant to be allowed to be released for visits with child through Dodge County Human Services.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

for discharge of probation

Called cases 15CF402 and 17CT229. Defendant, Sunny Marie Sparks in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent appears in court. Attorney Thompson heard, agent has requested to terminate probation early in the 15CF402, and def requested to settle 17CT229 today. Def heard. Atty Thompson heard, does not object to term early. Court heard, terminates probation in case 15CF402. Case 17CT229 - Court advises right to atty. Def wishes to proceed. Court accepts waiver, reviews charges, penalties and rights. Def pleads guilty. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea, withholds finding of guilt and places def on DPA.
Hearing on May 22, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Sunny Marie Sparks in court with attorney Jaclyn Shelton.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today to both amended counts; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to both Battery and DC; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Battery in Count 1 and DC in Count 2; State heard (submits photos/exhibit); Atty. Shelton heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. may report to P&P by 4pm on Wed. (has appointment set for tomorrow)

**W/H - 2 years PO concurrent - 3 days credit if revoked
- 30 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. 5/26/16 - Def. to be allowed to be released for visits with child thru human services
- $243 CC each count
- $200 DNA surcharge each count and sample
- Rest. to be determined - no claim for same
- AODA & FT
- no violent or abusive contact with anyone
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- not drive without valid DL
- Follow any mental health treatment

Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. State heard on bond; Court finds probable cause. Prelim 12/23/15 at 9:00am in Br. 3 (prior date of 12/30/15 given in court is wrong); Court sets $2,500 CASH Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, JMS, dob 9/23/04.
